pullRequest.body:
This is a (rather boring) technical step in developing the theory of Hurwitz zeta functions: one needs to show that certain
sums related to Jacobi theta series decay exponentially for large `t`. 

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
OK, I've made these lemmas private.

There is still one slight rough edge which is the placement of the lemmas about `UnitAddCircle`. One could formulate versions for `AddCircle T` for a general `T`; but they are false if `T = 0`. Lots of `AddCircle` lemmas get around this by adding `[Fact (0 < T)]` to the instance arguments. However, the typeclass instance machinery doesn't seem to be able to synthesise `[Fact (0 < 1)]` for the reals, and although there's a declaration for it (`Real.fact_zero_lt_one`), it's not a global instance at present (I don't know why). So any code which uses general `AddCircle` lemmas applied to `UnitAddCircle` ends up weighed down with incantations of `local attribute [instance] Real.fact_zero_lt_one`.

I'm going to try testing (and benchmarking) with `Real.fact_zero_lt_one` set globally to an instance, and we'll see if anything bad happens.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/4a6e6c87-593c-4492-ac35-4d0d3e870b25) for commit 5975d22b54358fc6a4e6f6b5b30b4f9f3e762619.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/bab147ed-ae2d-4b08-9d80-73d2d0e1d44d/to/4a6e6c87-593c-4492-ac35-4d0d3e870b25) against commit bec07a6b65f8334997cc186cede83b6eab8fabec.
Neither of the benchmark runs showed any significant slowdown; so I have included the more wide-ranging approach (a generic instance `Fact (0 < 1)` for any strict ordered semiring) into this PR.

I think this is now good to be merged.
maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by MichaelStollBayreuth.

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8679760699/job/23799132189)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8679760699/job/23799132113)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8679760699/job/23799132152)

```suggestion
    rw [show -Ï€ * (t * n ^ 2 - 2 * (|a| * (t * n))) + -Ï€ * (a ^ 2 * t) - -Ï€ * ((n + a) ^ 2 * t)
         = Ï€ * t * n * (|a| + a) * 2 by ring]
```
I think one should not rely on `ring_nf` producing a specific expression.

```suggestion
Here we use comparison with the series `âˆ‘ n * r ^ n`, where `r = exp (-Ï€ * t)`.
```
If you are going to need this again (this is the second occurrence), it may make sense to extract it as a lemma.

I feel this one is borderline in terms of whether it's interesting enough to extract. (One has an urge to generalise, e.g. replace `Ï€` by an arbitrary positive number, etc; but eventually one generalises it away to nothing at all.)
You could extract this and the next one and make them `private` in the file for the time being. If they appear to be useful in the further development, they can be made visible.
This is the second time this statement is needed. Extract?
This one's maybe a bit too specific, it's very unlikely to be ever needed again after this.
I've made it a private lemma as per your other suggestion.
This looks like it should go into a file related to `UnitAddCircle`. `#find_home` suggests `Mathlib.Analysis.SpecialFunctions.Trigonometric.Angle`.
I've moved this to the file where `AddCircle` and `UnitAddCircle` are defined.

I'd probably state the periodicity as a separate lemma and then use that in the definition.
But if inlining it does not lead to problems later, it is fine as is.
This idiom seems to work quite well (and avoids namespace clutter) so I'd rather leave it as-is.
Mabye use `q` in place of `n` to avoid confusion with the summation index?
This looks like a missing API lemma for `UnitAddCircle`.
I've moved this to the file where AddCircle and UnitAddCircle are defined.
This also looks like a lemma that could be useful more generally. It is again used below.
See above.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(NumberTheory/ModularForms): Asymptotics of Jacobi theta functions

source.title: Tracking issue for Hurwitz and Dirichlet L-series
